Pivot Concept Relationships

Source: vignettes/pivot-concept-relationships.Rmd
pivot-concept-relationships.Rmd
library(chariot)
library(tidyverse)
conn <- connectAthena()

Pivoting the Concept Relationship table can provide a rich array representing the various relationships an OMOP Concept may have.

To exemplify, a test dataset of RxNorm and RxNorm Extension concepts are retrieved.

test_data <- 
  get_test_drug_concepts(conn = conn)
#> [2021-05-26 15:55:10]    Overriding cache... Querying Athena...
#> [2021-05-26 15:55:10]    ✓ Open connection
#> [2021-05-26 15:55:10]    ✓ JDBC connection
#> [2021-05-26 15:55:10]    SQL: SELECT * FROM omop_vocabulary.concept c WHERE c.invalid_reason IS NULL AND c.vocabulary_id IN ('RxNorm', 'RxNorm Extension') AND c.standard_concept <> 'C' AND c.domain_id = 'Drug' ORDER BY RANDOM() LIMIT 100
#> [2021-05-26 15:55:10]    Querying...
#> [2021-05-26 15:55:13]    Querying...complete
#> [2021-05-26 15:55:13]    ✓ Returned data has more than 0 rows
#> [2021-05-26 15:55:13]    Caching resultset...
test_data
#> # A tibble: 100 x 10
#>    concept_id concept_name              domain_id vocabulary_id concept_class_id
#>         <int> <chr>                     <chr>     <chr>         <chr>           
#>  1   44095419 pyridoxine Oral Tablet [… Drug      RxNorm Exten… Branded Drug Fo…
#>  2   41134135 olanzapine 20 MG Oral Ta… Drug      RxNorm Exten… Marketed Product
#>  3   40928169 oxcarbazepine 300 MG Del… Drug      RxNorm Exten… Clinical Drug B…
#>  4   36505055 dexpanthenol / xylometaz… Drug      RxNorm Exten… Branded Drug Fo…
#>  5   21113628 Amiloride 2.5 MG / Furos… Drug      RxNorm Exten… Branded Drug Co…

#> 10   43804592 pregabalin 25 MG Oral Ca… Drug      RxNorm Exten… Marketed Product
#> # … with 90 more rows, and 5 more variables: standard_concept <chr>,
#> #   concept_code <chr>, valid_start_date <date>, valid_end_date <date>,
#> #   invalid_reason <chr>

The relationships of these concepts are derived.

test_data_relationships <- lookup_relationships(test_data$concept_id,
                                                conn = conn)
test_data_relationships
#> # A tibble: 881 x 21
#>    relationship_id  concept_id_1 concept_name_1      domain_id_1 vocabulary_id_1
#>    <chr>                   <int> <chr>               <chr>       <chr>          
#>  1 RxNorm has dose…     35786330 100 ML lansoprazol… Drug        RxNorm Extensi…
#>  2 Mapped from          35786330 100 ML lansoprazol… Drug        RxNorm Extensi…
#>  3 Maps to              35786330 100 ML lansoprazol… Drug        RxNorm Extensi…
#>  4 RxNorm has dose…     35853958 omacetaxine mepesu… Drug        RxNorm Extensi…
#>  5 Mapped from          35853958 omacetaxine mepesu… Drug        RxNorm Extensi…
#>  6 Maps to              35853958 omacetaxine mepesu… Drug        RxNorm Extensi…
#>  7 Consists of          35853958 omacetaxine mepesu… Drug        RxNorm Extensi…
#>  8 RxNorm has dose…     36505055 dexpanthenol / xyl… Drug        RxNorm Extensi…
#>  9 Mapped from          36505055 dexpanthenol / xyl… Drug        RxNorm Extensi…
#> 10 Maps to              36505055 dexpanthenol / xyl… Drug        RxNorm Extensi…
#> # … with 871 more rows, and 16 more variables: concept_class_id_1 <chr>,
#> #   standard_concept_1 <chr>, concept_code_1 <chr>, valid_start_date_1 <date>,
#> #   valid_end_date_1 <date>, invalid_reason_1 <chr>, concept_id_2 <int>,
#> #   concept_name_2 <chr>, domain_id_2 <chr>, vocabulary_id_2 <chr>,
#> #   concept_class_id_2 <chr>, standard_concept_2 <chr>, concept_code_2 <chr>,
#> #   valid_start_date_2 <date>, valid_end_date_2 <date>, invalid_reason_2 <chr>

To properly pivot the resultset, the concepts on both sides require transformation into a single cell per concept. This is achieved by converting concepts into the strip format.

test_data_relationships2 <-
  test_data_relationships %>%
  merge_strip(into = "concept_1", 
              suffix = "_1") %>%
  merge_strip(into = "concept_2",
              suffix = "_2")
test_data_relationships2
#> # A tibble: 881 x 5
#>    concept_2_id concept_2         concept_1_id concept_1         relationship_id
#>           <int> <chr>                    <int> <chr>             <chr>          
#>  1     19082191 [V] [N] 19082191…     35786330 [V] [S] 35786330… RxNorm has dos…
#>  2     35786330 [V] [S] 35786330…     35786330 [V] [S] 35786330… Mapped from    
#>  3     35786330 [V] [S] 35786330…     35786330 [V] [S] 35786330… Maps to        
#>  4     19082103 [V] [N] 19082103…     35853958 [V] [S] 35853958… RxNorm has dos…
#>  5     35853958 [V] [S] 35853958…     35853958 [V] [S] 35853958… Mapped from    
#>  6     35853958 [V] [S] 35853958…     35853958 [V] [S] 35853958… Maps to        
#>  7     35853962 [V] [S] 35853962…     35853958 [V] [S] 35853958… Consists of    
#>  8     19082165 [V] [N] 19082165…     36505055 [V] [S] 36505055… RxNorm has dos…
#>  9     36505055 [V] [S] 36505055…     36505055 [V] [S] 36505055… Mapped from    
#> 10     36505055 [V] [S] 36505055…     36505055 [V] [S] 36505055… Maps to        
#> # … with 871 more rows

The dataset can now be pivoted by the relationship, hinging on concept_1, which are the concepts that were originally inputted.

output <-
  test_data_relationships2 %>%
  pivot_wider(id_cols = concept_1,
              names_from = relationship_id, 
              values_from = concept_2)
#> Warning: Values are not uniquely identified; output will contain list-cols.
#> * Use `values_fn = list` to suppress this warning.
#> * Use `values_fn = length` to identify where the duplicates arise
#> * Use `values_fn = {summary_fun}` to summarise duplicates
output
#> # A tibble: 100 x 24
#>    concept_1     `RxNorm has dos… `Mapped from` `Maps to` `Consists of` `Box of`
#>    <chr>         <list>           <list>        <list>    <list>        <list>  
#>  1 [V] [S] 3578… <chr [1]>        <chr [1]>     <chr [1]> <NULL>        <NULL>  
#>  2 [V] [S] 3585… <chr [1]>        <chr [2]>     <chr [1]> <chr [1]>     <NULL>  
#>  3 [V] [S] 3650… <chr [1]>        <chr [1]>     <chr [1]> <NULL>        <NULL>  
#>  4 [V] [S] 4072… <chr [1]>        <chr [1]>     <chr [1]> <NULL>        <chr [1…
#>  5 [V] [S] 4084… <chr [1]>        <chr [1]>     <chr [1]> <NULL>        <chr [1…
#>  6 [V] [S] 4092… <NULL>           <chr [1]>     <chr [1]> <NULL>        <NULL>  
#>  7 [V] [S] 4092… <NULL>           <chr [1]>     <chr [1]> <NULL>        <NULL>  
#>  8 [V] [S] 4096… <chr [1]>        <chr [1]>     <chr [1]> <NULL>        <chr [1…
#>  9 [V] [S] 4098… <NULL>           <chr [1]>     <chr [1]> <NULL>        <NULL>  
#> 10 [V] [S] 4099… <chr [1]>        <chr [1]>     <chr [1]> <NULL>        <chr [1…
#> # … with 90 more rows, and 18 more variables: Tradename of <list>,
#> #   Has marketed form <list>, Constitutes <list>, Has quantified form <list>,
#> #   Marketed form of <list>, Has supplier <list>, Available as box <list>,
#> #   Quantified form of <list>, RxNorm is a <list>, Has tradename <list>,
#> #   Has brand name <list>, Concept replaces <list>, RxNorm inverse is a <list>,
#> #   RxNorm has ing <list>, RxNorm ing of <list>, Drug has drug class <list>,
#> #   RxNorm - SPL <list>, RxNorm - Source eq <list>

Since at times a concept_1 may have a specific relationship to more than 1 concept_2, a list-cols are returned in the output. To create a more readable output, an aggregate function on concept_2 must be supplied to convert multiple concept_2 values into a string of length 1.

output <-
  test_data_relationships2 %>%
  pivot_wider(id_cols = concept_1,
              names_from = relationship_id, 
              values_from = concept_2,
              # Add aggregate function
              values_fn = list(concept_2 = ~ paste(unique(.), collapse = "|"))
              )
output
#> # A tibble: 100 x 24
#>    concept_1  `RxNorm has dose… `Mapped from`  `Maps to`  `Consists of` `Box of`
#>    <chr>      <chr>             <chr>          <chr>      <chr>         <chr>   
#>  1 [V] [S] 3… [V] [N] 19082191… [V] [S] 35786… [V] [S] 3… <NA>          <NA>    
#>  2 [V] [S] 3… [V] [N] 19082103… [V] [S] 35853… [V] [S] 3… [V] [S] 3585… <NA>    
#>  3 [V] [S] 3… [V] [N] 19082165… [V] [S] 36505… [V] [S] 3… <NA>          <NA>    
#>  4 [V] [S] 4… [V] [N] 19082103… [V] [S] 40720… [V] [S] 4… <NA>          [V] [S]…
#>  5 [V] [S] 4… [V] [N] 19082573… [V] [S] 40848… [V] [S] 4… <NA>          [V] [S]…
#>  6 [V] [S] 4… <NA>              [V] [S] 40922… [V] [S] 4… <NA>          <NA>    
#>  7 [V] [S] 4… <NA>              [V] [S] 40923… [V] [S] 4… <NA>          <NA>    
#>  8 [V] [S] 4… [V] [N] 19082573… [V] [S] 40965… [V] [S] 4… <NA>          [V] [S]…
#>  9 [V] [S] 4… <NA>              [V] [S] 40984… [V] [S] 4… <NA>          <NA>    
#> 10 [V] [S] 4… [V] [N] 19135866… [V] [S] 40996… [V] [S] 4… <NA>          [V] [S]…
#> # … with 90 more rows, and 18 more variables: Tradename of <chr>,
#> #   Has marketed form <chr>, Constitutes <chr>, Has quantified form <chr>,
#> #   Marketed form of <chr>, Has supplier <chr>, Available as box <chr>,
#> #   Quantified form of <chr>, RxNorm is a <chr>, Has tradename <chr>,
#> #   Has brand name <chr>, Concept replaces <chr>, RxNorm inverse is a <chr>,
#> #   RxNorm has ing <chr>, RxNorm ing of <chr>, Drug has drug class <chr>,
#> #   RxNorm - SPL <chr>, RxNorm - Source eq <chr>

The resulting dataset contains a row for each original concept provided with each relationship and concept/s it has the relationship to in a pipe-separated string.
